org.jcvi.jillion.internal.core.io

Enum ValueSizeStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ValueSizeStrategy>
      • org.jcvi.jillion.internal.core.io.ValueSizeStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<ValueSizeStrategy>

    public enum ValueSizeStrategy
extends Enum<ValueSizeStrategy>
    ValueSizeStrategy is a strategy pattern implementation to abstract away the number of bytes read/written to a ByteBuffer. This simplifies algorithms and allows read/write operations to be written once and re-used by different implementations that need to read/write different sized data.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants

      INTEGER 
      NONE
      No values can be read or written.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • NONE

        public static final ValueSizeStrategy NONE
        No values can be read or written. Takes up zero bytes. Will throw IllegalArgumentExceptions if getNext(ByteBuffer) or put(ByteBuffer, int) are called.

      • BYTE

        public static final ValueSizeStrategy BYTE

      • SHORT

        public static final ValueSizeStrategy SHORT

      • INTEGER

        public static final ValueSizeStrategy INTEGER

        for (ValueSizeStrategy c : ValueSizeStrategy.values())
    System.out.println(c);

        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static ValueSizeStrategy valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:

      • getNext

        public abstract int getNext(ByteBuffer buf)
        Gets the next value from the given buffer.
        Parameters:
        buf - the ByteBuffer to read from.
        Returns:
        the value read from the buffer as an int.

      • put

        public abstract void put(ByteBuffer buf,
                         int value)
        puts the given value into the buffer. If this implementation reads/writes data smaller than an int, the passed in value will be cast down to the appropriate size.
        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer to write to.
        value - the value to write (must not be larger than the MAX_SIZE of the implementation value size.

      • getNumberOfBytesPerValue

        public abstract int getNumberOfBytesPerValue()
        Get the number of bytes used to store each value in a buffer.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes used; never < 1.

      • getStrategyFor

        public static ValueSizeStrategy getStrategyFor(int largestValue)
        Get the ValueSizeStrategy implementation given the largest possible input value.
        Parameters:
        largestValue - the largest input value that will be written to a buffer.
        Returns:
        the ValueSizeStrategy implementation that can read and write up to and including the given largestValue but use the least amount of bytes to do it.
